posts.name: Justin Ho
posts.cooked:
We have been having problems with our radio the past few weeks. It was working perfectly fine up to competition and during competition, but when we tried to test it after competition, the WiFi no longer worked. An ethernet connection still works, but we cannot connect wireless at all.

DIP switch 3 (2.4 GHz) has always been on, except at competition. We currently do not have the proper materials to use the radio in Access Point Mode. Whenever we turn on the robot, the power light is on, after booting the SYS light flashes at 20 Hz, and the RIO light is on but blinks randomly. The blinking was seen before competition though. We have seen a small green glow from the 6 GHz light, but is very light and I assume the light is just leaking from the RIO light as it also flashes with it. So, neither the 2.4 GHz nor the 6 GHz light ever turn on. The radio is powered from the 12V port and PoE, which are plugged into the 12V/2A ports on the VRM .

We have tried swapping out the radio with another VH-109 and it has worked. We have tried different configurations for power and ethernet connections on the radio such as just ethernet and 12V or only PoE, and none of them have worked. We have reconfigured the radio and re uploaded the firmware multiple times already. We somehow got it working once, but the next day it stopped working. It has been over a week since it has worked.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Correction: The 6 GHz light does actually turn on during startup. It disappears when SYS light starts blinking though.

Edit: We fixed it. I believe it was the ethernet cable as I tried configuring it with a different ethernet cable and it started working after. We also re-flipped the DIP switch and power cycled the robot afterwards.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
Have you reprogrammed it?

During the svwnt, it was programmed to be a client and connect to the field using a secret/not-known-by-you access credentials.

After every event, you have to reprogram it to be an AP and allow your computer to connect.

Edit: I have reading comprehension problems on my phone apparently. Sorry; you indicated you reprogrammed above.

posts.name: Dave Ebersol
posts.cooked: We ended up using one as an access point to utalize the 6G capabilities

posts.name: Floyd Conrad Davis
posts.cooked: We have the exact same problem, except we haven’t been able to reprogram it. robot.local said that it successfully reconfigured, but the Rio link status light didn’t stop blinking and we still couldn’t connect wirelessly. We haven’t switched out the ethernet cable yet, but if anyone has any other ideas they would be greatly appreciated.

posts.name: Justin Ho
posts.cooked: Unfortunately our solution stopped working…kinda. Now it only works about half the time. After having much trouble trying to fix it, we just decided to replace it with the radio that wasn’t sent to competition, at least for now. If we find a solution, we’ll get back to you!

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
@Herekittycat4

Id recommend you both reach out to official support for your radio troubles.
